title: Unpopular Opinion: Malzahar should honestly receive a nerf.
body:
As the title says...

Whenever I am up against a {{champion:90}}; he is very oppressive to lane against, no matter who you are. Once he reaches level 6, you can't get close to Malzahar without dying or coming out with low health.

I am aware of the counterplay - I do know how to counter him.

replies.body:
My one and only issue with Malzahar is his ult, and it's for how much is packed into one button press.

Point and click (Cannot miss or accidentally hit minions)
Instantaneous (0 second reaction time) 
2.5 second suppression (A long time + Unable to cleanse OR negate with tenacity) 
Does a lot of percent max health damage (Building anything but strict MR is borderline useless)
Has medium range (Doesn't really have to enter a very compromising position to use it)
Refreshes Malefic visions (More damage)

If he gets a gank, it's almost a 100% secured kill if you're not literally touching your tower. Also, unless you're an artillery mage, you'll have a hard time getting rid of his passive to make that ult a bit more threatening to use.

Outside of that, he's pretty much a wave clear DPS mage with a silence, which doesn't bother me too much. Everyone's allowed to have their own purpose, but that ult man. If Riot ever touches him, I think that's what they should look at first.

You are correct. If Riot added other ways to cancel the ult or mitigage some damage I would be fine. But even with Hexdrinker he can just blow through it no problem. Even worse is the extremely low cooldown it has. Please add a way for mages to be able to escape. QSS is mlr for the AD champs.

Patch 7.22

Malzahar

R - Nether Grasp

*Dance it off!* - While suppressed by Nether Grasp, extreme level DDR inputs will appear on the targets screen. If they maintain a perfect score for 1 second they break out.
Mages tend to be ranged am I not right? So they don't need an item counter for malzahar. Qss is for melee champs because they need it because they can't stay out of range and kill him.

His ult range is 700 units. That's just about a level 18 Tristana's basic attack range. That isn't something to just shrug off. "Staying out of range" isn't always an option, especially when you're trying to farm. If all else fails, flash adds another 400 range to make it effectively 1100 range. Slightly below Lux's Q range on an instant cast suppression.

Again. If you're not glued to your tower, it's a *guaranteed* kill from a gank if he ults you and you don't have {{item:3140}} (If you're a mage, you won't)
If you are a ranged champ and he tried to stop you from farming then that means he is over extended and is very vulnerable to banks because he has no mobility.
QSS is for AD champions, not melee ones.
Not really. Ap champs can get this early and sell this late game
and delay their build by 1300g because it upgrades into a virtually worthless item.

Play a couple games as Malz. You will realize that a ton of his damage is DoT, which allows counterplay via shields, heals, etc. Especially in early-mid, in order to do real damage he needs his minions. Problem is, they die with one AA and are easily cleared with AoE. clear his minions as soon as he casts them and watch him struggle to farm.

His ult is powerful, but it has to be to compensate for the DoT aspect of his kit. Plus, don't forget he is a sitting duck in teamfights the second he uses it.

Oh I understand he isn't some immortal untouchable being. His voidlings are as squishy as they are essential. He has very little 'burst' (Put in quotations since you alone can't fight back for 2.5 seconds, still not burst though) and in team fights he has to ult the right person at the right time or get blown to kingdom come. 

My ONLY issue with Malzahar is his laning ult when paired with a jungler. I know 2v1's should naturally be in favor of the 2, but Malzahar just adds a whole new layer of helplessness to that. If at any time I happen to be within 700 units of him,  and his jungler is less than 2 seconds away from appearing in lane, I've already died. I just have to wait for the screen to go grey-scale.

Fair, but that is arguably true for plenty of mages with good (although not necessarily equal) cc, e.g. Ori ult on her tanky jungler. He has superb lockdown, but clear weaknesses to balance that strength.

i hope yall realize that  his ulti is the only thing that makes hime viable. If its cahnged to something else he instanly becomes trash tier. He is a single target killing monster but outside of it he isnt good. The other issue with malz is that when the enemy team does do ythe smart thing and buys qss he is literally useless, and these ppl want to be able to cleanse it too. Ridiculus. Qss is a bane for malz if you have it he literally camnt touch you, unelees ur low as hell health. Piont is malz's ulti is his entire playstyle without it he is nothing.

From my experience the problem is not that Malzahar lacks waveclear before level 7, the actual problem is how much mana he wastes waveclearing before getting a {{item:3802}}. After getting that item, Malzahar has no mana issues at all. However, before getting it, Malzahar struggles and will usually be outpushed by champions that do not use as much mana when waveclearing, especially because he relies on his voidlings to waveclear and they are easy to destroy.

On my opinion this is a good thing because it means he has an actual, exploitable weakness that you can abuse.
